data.title: List of Alternate Monarchs and Aristocratic Lineage II
data.meta_description:
Saxe-Lauenburg

Duke Magnus I of Saxe-Lauenburg (1470-1543) >< Catherine of Brunswick-Wolfenbüttel (1488-1563)
A1. Duke Franz I of Saxe-Lauenburg...

Did Wilhelm V abdicate his title as Duke of Brunswick-Calenberg so he can go rule the Duchy of Brunswick-Lüneburg?

Do any of Wilhelm I of Brunswick-Harburg’s sons have issue to continue the Duchy of Brunswick-Harburg?

Is Sweden still ruled by the House of Bjälbo as of 1650?

Is Geneva a member of the Swiss Confederation?

What is preventing Isabella from inheriting Navarre?

Funny you should mention it, I didn't realise I had posted this one.

Who would become King of Burgundy if the House of Burgundy went extinct?

Who would become King of Burgundy if the House of Burgundy went extinct?

1. Earl of Chester.

2. Slightly less powerful than in OTL at that time.

3. The closest living relative of the deceased king through the female line. For example, if Philip V had died young or without offspring, Isabelle would inherit after Philip IV's death.

POD: Ferdinand and Anna's children genderswap.

2. Archduchess Elizabeth (1527-1576) m. King Sigsmund II Augustus (1520-1572) [2].​

3. Holy Roman Emperor Ferdinand (1528-1590) m. Maria of Austria (1528-1603). [3].​

4. Archduchess Anna (1529-1595) m. Albert, Duke of Bavaria (1528-1579) [4].​

​

1. Maximilian had his female counterpart's frailty. He died at nineteen, just a year before his wedding.

2. Elizabeth had her male counterpart's fertility. Sigsmund might not like her very much, but she gave him five healthy sons so he is not complaining.

3. As Maximilian was not married to Maria when he died, she was free to marry his brother. Ferdinand is not as tolerant as OTL Maximilian was and is currently dealing with a very divided empire.

4. The OTL reason for this match was to stop the rivalry between Austria and Bavaria. I saw no reason to change it in TL.

5. One of Elizabeth's suitors espically during Mary I's reign. He and Elizabeth got along shockingly well, but alas, their religious differences became too much in the end.

6. I figured Ferdinand would name at least two sons for his wife's family. He joined the church.

7. The irony of having a Philip marry a Joanna was too delicious for me to resist. Philip went through his historical first wives, but married Joanna instead of Elizabeth of France.

8. Ferdinand and Anna were running out of boys' names and Anna just said, let's name him after my father. Much happier than his OTL counterpart, probably ended up marrying one of his nieces.

A timeline I will never write - Henry Fitzroy survives and becomes King after Edward VI.

I gotta say, I’m not convinced that Edward would execute Mary, as long as she kept her head down. I can see her essentially abandoning court and living quietly until her death. Also, no Elizabeth for Mary and fitzroy? Really?
